intro: Johnstonella grayi var. cryptochaeta, commonly known as the cryptochaeta variant of Johnstonella grayi, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. This variant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, round fruits known as schizocarps. The plant is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
